ðŸ’¡ parsec-vdd | C#
ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: Creating virtual displays for gaming, streaming, and remote work on Windows systems.
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ Standalone virtual display driver â€¢ IddCx API usage â€¢ High resolution and refresh rate support (up to 4K and 240 Hz) â€¢ Virtual display management app (ParsecVDisplay) â€¢ Core API for direct control of the driver
ðŸ“– Summary: The parsec-vdd repository provides a standalone solution for creating virtual displays on Windows hosts using the Parsec Virtual Display Driver (VDD), independent of the Parsec app. It leverages the IddCx API to generate virtual displays with support for high resolutions and refresh rates, making it suitable for gaming, streaming, or remote work.
ðŸ”— Links: â€¢ View Project ================ ðŸ”“ Open Source

ðŸŒŸ nightwatcher | Python
ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: Viewing IP camera streams in a web browser with custom detection capabilities.
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ Blazing fast streaming â€¢ Cross Platform Support â€¢ Privacy & Extensibility (Local models and custom detection) â€¢ Simplicity
ðŸ“– Summary: Night Watcher is a web-based IP camera viewer designed for fast and simple streaming in any browser. It offers features like custom detection, cross-platform support, and privacy through local models, aiming for a user-friendly experience.
ðŸ”— Links: â€¢ View Project ================ ðŸ”“ Open Source

ðŸ’¡ Grid-Mobile | Dart
ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: Secure and private location sharing with trusted contacts.
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ End-to-End Encryption (E2EE) â€¢ Matrix Protocol Integration â€¢ Cross-Platform (iOS and Android) â€¢ Real-Time Location Sharing â€¢ Self-Hosted Capability
ðŸ“– Summary: Grid-Mobile is a cross-platform mobile application (iOS and Android) built with Flutter for private location sharing. It uses end-to-end encryption (E2EE) and integrates with the Matrix protocol for secure, decentralized communication, offering users control over who can access their location data.
ðŸ”— Links: â€¢ View Project â€¢ Homepage ================ ðŸ”“ Open Source

ðŸ”¥ spotify-downloader | Python
ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: Downloading music from Spotify for offline listening and archival purposes.
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ Downloads Spotify playlists and songs â€¢ Fetches album art â€¢ Retrieves lyrics â€¢ Embeds metadata â€¢ Command-line interface
ðŸ“– Summary: The spotify-downloader repository, also known as spotDL, is a Python-based command-line tool that downloads music from Spotify playlists and songs. It finds matching songs on YouTube, downloads them, and embeds album art, lyrics, and metadata into the downloaded files.
ðŸ”— Links: â€¢ View Project â€¢ Homepage ================ ðŸ”“ Open Source

âœ¨ osaurus | Swift
ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: Local LLM inference on Apple Silicon Macs with OpenAI and Ollama-compatible APIs.
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ Native MLX runtime â€¢ Apple Silicon only â€¢ OpenAI API compatible â€¢ Ollama-compatible â€¢ Function/Tool calling
ðŸ“– Summary: Osaurus is a native, Apple Silicon-only local LLM server, similar to Ollama. It leverages Apple's MLX framework for optimized performance on M-series chips. It features a SwiftUI app and a SwiftNIO server, providing OpenAI and Ollama-compatible endpoints for local LLM inference.
ðŸ”— Links: â€¢ View Project â€¢ Homepage ================ ðŸ”“ Open Source

ðŸŒŸ wifi-3d-fusion | Python
ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: Estimating 3D human pose for spatial awareness applications.
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ 3D human pose estimation using WiFi CSI signals â€¢ Fusion of wireless sensing and computer vision â€¢ Deep learning-based pose estimation â€¢ Integration with ESP32 devices for data acquisition â€¢ Visualization using Three.js and Open3D
ðŸ“– Summary: WiFi-3D-Fusion is a research project that uses WiFi Channel State Information (CSI) and deep learning to estimate 3D human pose. It combines wireless sensing and computer vision to achieve spatial awareness, enabling applications like activity recognition and human-computer interaction.
ðŸ”— Links: â€¢ View Project ================ ðŸ”“ Open Source

ðŸ’¡ agent-c | C
ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: Creating AI agents that can execute shell commands using the OpenRouter API.
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ Tool Calling (shell command execution) â€¢ Optimized Binaries (small size) â€¢ Conversation Memory (sliding window) â€¢ Cross-Platform (macOS and Linux)
ðŸ“– Summary: Agent-C is an ultra-lightweight AI agent written in C that interacts with the OpenRouter API to execute shell commands. It features a small binary size, conversation memory, and cross-platform compatibility (macOS and Linux).
ðŸ”— Links: â€¢ View Project â€¢ Homepage ================ ðŸ”“ Open Source

ðŸ”¥ growchief | TypeScript
ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: Automating social media interactions and outreach campaigns.
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ Concurrency handling â€¢ Enrichment workflow â€¢ Working hours consideration â€¢ Proxy support â€¢ Human-like automation
ðŸ“– Summary: GrowChief is an open-source social media automation tool designed to automate interactions on social media platforms, such as sending connection requests and follow-up messages. It's built with features like concurrency handling, enrichment workflows, working hour consideration, proxy support, and human-like automation using Playwright and Patchright for stealth.
